thread.title: Exciting Gabriel Jesus will need time to adapt at Manchester City, claims Clichy
thread.title_full: Exciting Gabriel Jesus will need time to adapt at Manchester City, claims Clichy

title: Exciting Gabriel Jesus will need time to adapt at Manchester City, claims Clichy
text:
0 Jan 5, 2017 09:44:56 The French defender is convinced that the Brazilian will prove to be a fine addition once he has settled and is expecting 'many goals' 
Manchester City defender Gael Clichy is confident Gabriel Jesus will be a success in the Premier League, but has warned the Brazil international will need time to adapt to his new surroundings. 
The 19-year-old has built a reputation as one of the most exciting youngsters in world football after scoring four goals in his first six Brazil caps and helping Palmeiras to the title in his homeland last year. 
Guardiola: I'm very good, but lucky 
Clichy is looking forward to teaming up with Jesus at the Etihad Stadium as City look to breathe new life into their faltering title bid. 
"When a team like City bring in a player he is a quality player, so it is always good to have someone coming in, fresh legs and a new body," Clichy was quoted as saying by the Manchester Evening News . 
"He will need time to adjust but I hope he can be that good and make an impact as soon as possible. 
"We will help him to get to his full potential as soon as possible, because in football people want results. 
How City's fans have wound up Pep 
"I know he is really good, I have spoken to the Brazilian players. And a player from Brazil being bought by City is sure to have quality. 
"It is an exciting moment for him, for us and for the fans and we hope he can score many goals." Related
